clinical_study.official_title: Biomarkers and Associated Outcomes in Patients With Pneumonia

brief_summary.textblock: To identifying biomarkers in patients with pneumonia

detailed_description.textblock: The aim of this study is to identify the biomarkers in patients with pneumonia. These biomarkers can distinguish community-acquired pneumonia, hospital-acquired pneumonia, severe pneumonia, bacterial infection, virus infection and fungal infection. Furthermore, these biomarkers can identify the efficacy of treatment in patients with different interventions.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From diagnosis of pneumonia to discharge from hospital or up to 90 days, whichever came first

secondary_outcome.description: The pneumonia deteriorated and reached the criteria of severe pneumonia. Severe pneumonia was diagnosed according to the guideline published by ATS.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From diagnosis of pneumonia to discharge from hospital or up to 90 days, whichever came first
secondary_outcome.description: Initial treatment failure means the patients' condition progressively deteriorated although comprehensive treatment was administrated. As a result, the treatment should be changed or the patient required admission to ICU.
